text: Agusan del Sur's 1st congressional district is the congressional district of the Philippines in Agusan del Sur. It has been represented in the House of Representatives of the Philippines since 2010. Previously included in Agusan del Sur's at-large congressional district from 1987 to 2010, it encompasses the northern part of the province, bordering Agusan del Norte. It is currently represented in the 18th Congress by Alfelito Bascug of the National Unity Party. == Representation history == {| class="wikitable" |- ! rowspan="2" |# ! colspan="2" rowspan="2" |Member ! colspan="2" |Term of office ! rowspan="2" |Congress ! rowspan="2" |Party ! rowspan="2" |Electoral history ! rowspan="2" |Constituent LGUs |- !Start !End |- | colspan="9" style="text-align:center;" |District created October 20, 2008, redistricted from Agusan del Sur's at- large district. |- | rowspan="3" |1 | rowspan="2" style="background:;" | | rowspan="3" |Maria Valentina Plaza | rowspan="3" |June 30, 2010 | rowspan="3" |June 30, 2019 |15th | rowspan="2"|NUP |Re-elected in 2010. | rowspan="4" align="center" |2010–present: Bayugan, Esperanza, Prosperidad, San Luis, Sibagat, Talacogon |- |16th |Re- elected in 2013. |- | style="background:;" | |17th |PDP–Laban |Re-elected in 2016. |- |2 | style="background:;" | |Alfelito Bascug |June 30, 2019 |Present |18th |NUP |Re-elected in 2019. |} == Election results == === 2010 === === 2013 === === 2016 === === 2019 === == See also == * Legislative districts of Agusan del Sur == References == Category:Congressional districts of the Philippines Category:Politics of Agusan del Sur Category:2008 establishments in the Philippines
